content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Coal Mining Station at (-14.0, -15.0)
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, -15.0)
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) storing coal

###Iron Ore Mining Station at (-14.0, 23.0)
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0) 
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) storing iron ore

###Iron Smelting Line at (-10.0, 20.0)
- Two stone furnaces at (-11.0, 20.0) and (-9.0, 20.0)

###Copper Processing Line at (20.0, 20.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) mining copper ore
- Middle wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) storing copper ore
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0) for smelting copper ore
- Burner inserter at (23.5, 21.5) to feed ore from middle chest to furnace
- Output wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) storing copper plates
- Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) to move plates from furnace to output chest

ERROR TIPS

### Inserter placement and rotation issues
- Ensure inserter pickup and drop positions align properly with source and destination entities
- Double check inserter rotation matches the intended material flow direction
- Verify there is a valid destination entity before placing inserters to avoid "output blocked" warnings

### Fuel management issues
- Keep mining drills fueled to prevent "out of fuel" warnings and work stoppages
- Monitor fuel levels in burner inserters and furnaces

### Production line efficiency
- Ensure proper material flow between connected entities
- Verify furnaces have both fuel and ingredients to operate efficiently
- Monitor chest inventory levels to prevent backups or shortages
